items.title: How Are New York City Taxi Plates Assigned?
items.abstract: A cab’s medallion number is the same as a vehicle’s plate number, but that’s not all.

items.title: N.Y.U. to Add a Bachelor’s Degree in Video Game Design
items.abstract: A department within the New York University Tisch School of the Arts will soon begin accepting applicants for a bachelor of fine arts in game design.

items.title: City Panel Moves to Designate Stonewall Inn as a Landmark
items.abstract: New York City’s Landmarks Preservation Commission is scheduled to vote on adding the building to its calendar, the first step toward designating it as a historic property worthy of protection.

items.title: Phil Patton, Design Writer Who Scrutinized the Everyday, Dies at 63
items.abstract: Mr. Patton’s keen eye for objects and their hidden significance made him a sought-after contributor to magazines including Art in America, Esquire, Smithsonian and Wired.

items.title: The City’s Most Arresting Signs Over the Decades
items.abstract: A new book featuring the photographs of Lee Friedlander shows the significance of random public announcements like ‘No Parking’ and ‘Everything Must Go!’
keywords: Traffic and Parking Signals and Signs
